name: Vodka
description: A neutral grain spirit, often used as a base for cocktails due to its mild flavor.

name: Gin
description: A distilled spirit flavored with juniper berries, commonly used in cocktails like martinis and gin and tonics.

name: Rum
description: A distilled spirit produced from sugarcane molasses, often used in cocktails like daiquiris and mojitos.

name: Tequila
description: A distilled spirit made from the fermented juice of the blue agave plant, typically used in margaritas and palomas.

name: Whiskey
description: A distilled spirit made from fermented grain mash, often aged in oak barrels, and used in cocktails like Manhattans and whiskey sours.

name: Triple Sec
description: An orange liqueur used in cocktails like Margaritas and Singapore Slings.

name: Cointreau
description: Another orange liqueur, similar to Triple Sec, but with a slightly sweeter flavor.

name: Amaretto
description: An almond-flavored liqueur used in cocktails like the Amaretto Sour and the Disaronno Fizz.

name: Baileys Irish Cream
description: A liqueur made with Irish whiskey, cream, and chocolate, often served on its own or in cocktails.

name: Kahlúa
description: A coffee liqueur used in cocktails like the Black Russian and the B-52.

name: Tonic Water
description: A carbonated water with a quinine-based flavor, commonly used with gin.

name: Soda Water
description: Plain carbonated water, often used as a mixer in cocktails.

name: Orange Juice
description: A citrus juice commonly used in cocktails, such as the Screwdriver and the Mimosa.

name: Grapefruit Juice
description: A citrus juice with a tart flavor, often used in cocktails like the Paloma and the Salty Dog.

name: Cranberry Juice
description: A tart and tangy berry juice, used in cocktails like the Cosmopolitan and the Cape Codder.

name: Pineapple Juice
description: A tropical juice with a sweet and tart flavor, often used in cocktails like the Piña Colada and the Zombie.

name: Simple Syrup
description: A sweetener made with equal parts sugar and water, commonly used in cocktails.

name: Grenadine
description: A pomegranate syrup with a sweet and tart flavor, often used in cocktails like the Shirley Temple and the Tequila Sunrise.

name: Honey Syrup
description: A sweetener made with honey and water, adding a unique flavor to cocktails.

name: Angostura Bitters
description: A concentrated botanical extract with a complex flavor profile, used in small amounts to add complexity and depth to cocktails.

name: Milk
description: Used in cocktails like the White Russian and the Milk Punch, adding a creamy texture.

name: Cream
description: Used in cocktails like the Brandy Alexander and the Irish Coffee, adding a rich and creamy texture.

name: Eggs
description: Used in cocktails like the Ramos Gin Fizz and the Pisco Sour, adding a frothy and rich texture.

name: Cinnamon
description: A warm spice commonly used in seasonal cocktails, such as hot toddies and egg nog.

name: Nutmeg
description: A warm spice often used in eggnog and other seasonal cocktails.

name: Cloves
description: A warm spice with a pungent aroma, often used in holiday cocktails like mulled wine and spiced cider.

name: Mint
description: A fresh herb with a cooling and refreshing flavor, commonly used in cocktails like the Mint Julep and the Mojito.

name: Basil
description: A fresh herb with a sweet and savory flavor, often used in cocktails like the Basil Gimlet and the Cucumber Basil Spritz.

name: Rosemary
description: A fresh herb with a woody and pine-like flavor, sometimes used in savory cocktails like the Bloody Mary and the Greyhound.

name: Berries
description: A variety of berries, such as strawberries, raspberries, and blueberries, are often used as garnishes or flavorings in cocktails.

name: Citrus Slices
description: Thin slices of citrus fruits, such as oranges, lemons, and limes, are commonly used as garnishes in cocktails.

name: Cherries
description: Maraschino cherries are a popular garnish for cocktails, adding a touch of sweetness and color.
